results.title: The King's tailor
results.brief_description: An animated comedy presenting a tailor who mends his King’s trousers. Animation by Ub Iwerks. Music soundtrack only.

results.title: The King's musick
results.creator_credit: Angel Productions, Daniel M. Angel and Victor M. Gover
results.brief_description: A tour of inspection of the Royal Military School of Music at Knellar Hall, Britain. Shows early musical instruments such as the serpent, the shawn and the French hunting horn, and gives an insight into the various methods of training, in conducting and in the playing of different instruments. The film closes with an open air performance of ‘The Evening hymn’ and ‘Abide with me’.

results.title: The King's life guard
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, Alexander Shaw and Muir Mathieson
results.brief_description: The ceremony of the Changing of the Guard. Shows the preparation of the household cavalry at the Royal barracks and stables followed by the procession and finally the actual ceremony.

results.title: The Kinetic sculpture of Gordon Barlow
results.brief_description: Large patterns of dominoes, each toppling the next, demonstrate the famous theory. Slowly they rise, to topple again. Brightly painted ping pong balls rise and fall in plastic boxes, and coloured cubes revolve in a changing spectrum of colour. The striking photography greatly enhances the imaginative qualities of Gordon Barlow’s work. Music by Bobby Christian, photographed by Steve Heiser and Lutz Hopke. (Award: Atlanta)

results.title: The Kind hearted ant
results.creator_credit: Zagreb Film, Aleksandar Marks and Vladimir Jutrisa
results.brief_description: In an anthill of five million ants, there is always one ant out of step. Based on a Yugoslavian children’s song, this animated film tells the story of an ant who unintentionally disrupts the harmony and order of the ant-hill. A sardonic survey of insect behaviour, charming and genuinely funny using a striking yet simple visual style.

results.title: The Kimberley: land of the Wandjina [DVD] (A)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit and Jeremy Hogarth
results.brief_description: Narrated by Leo McKern, this documentary, produced by the award-winning ABC TV Natural History Unit, explores the land and life of the spectacular Kimberley region of North West Australia. Aboriginal people believe that the Wandjina, the rain spirits, created the landscape. From the vast coastal mudflats to the tidal rivers and inland waterways, this beautifully photographed film explores in detail one of the least known regions of Australia.

results.title: The Killing of Sister George [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Palomar Pictures, Associates and Aldrich Company and Robert Aldrich
results.brief_description: The erosion of a longtime lesbian affair between a television star (Beryl Reid) who plays the role of “Sister George” the bleeding heart heroine on a British TV soap opera and her younger lover (Susannah York). The breakup of the relationship comes about when a broadcast executive who fancies the younger woman, decides to write Reid out of her key TV role. The basic thrust of the plot is the gradual development of a rapport and sympathy with Reid, in inverse ratio to the loss of respect for York. The film received an X rating on its release due to a controversial five-minute lesbian love scene. Director Robert Aldrich achieved the look and feel of a “Made in Britain” picture, although most of it was shot near downtown LA. Cast also includes Carol Browne, Ronald Fraser, Patricia Medina and Hugh Paddick. Screenplay by Lukas Heller from the play by Frank Marcus.

results.title: The Killing of Angelo Tsakos
results.brief_description: In 1985, Angelo Tsakos, a young Greek-Australian boy from the depressed western suburbs of Sydney was shot dead while driving a stolen car, by a probationary police constable. He was only sixteen. At the inquiry into the incident, three differing versions of the event were described. This film reconstructs these versions and finds questions still unanswered. His family continue in their efforts to get a full enquiry into the killing of Angelo Tsakos.

results.title: The Killing of Angel Street
results.brief_description: Jessica Simmonds returns home from London and is shocked to find the street she grew up in being torn apart to make way for a high rise development. She sympathises with the plight of the local residents, who are being forced out of their homes by the brutal tactics of the developers. Probing into the background of Angel street development, she unearths a sinister connection between organised crime, the developer, the police and the highest levels of government.
